content: @Sumana Harihareswara Thanks! that answers my question.
Glad to help @Rohan B! What do you think you might work on?

I'm currently looking into the '2016 roadmap' to find out an effective way to contribute. I worked with Django in the past so I think I'll catch on pretty quick. I'd like to participate in GSOC 2017 with zulip as the organisation as a secondary goal, the primary goal being making contributions in general.
@Rohan B cool! Welcome to the community :). We can definitely point you to some good starter issues if you give us some info about your interests

@Christie Koehler I set the line-endings to go with your suggestion, and I think that fixed it up until the point where I began having more errors
@Diptanshu Jamgade I'm currently busy with some work, but when I find the time I will contact you!
@Daniel Sun Sure.

Hey, I tried install Zulip to Ubuntu 16.04.1 (VirtualBox-based), but I got stuck to following error message:

+ pip install --no-deps --requirement /root/zulip/requirements/py2_prod.txt
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/zulip/scripts/lib/create-production-venv", line 22, in <module>
    cached_venv_path = setup_virtualenv(args.target, os.path.join(ZULIP_PATH, "requirements", "py2_prod.txt"))
  File "/root/zulip/scripts/lib/setup_venv.py", line 70, in setup_virtualenv
    do_setup_virtualenv(cached_venv_path, requirements_file, virtualenv_args or [])
  File "/root/zulip/scripts/lib/setup_venv.py", line 97, in do_setup_virtualenv
    run(["pip", "install", "--no-deps", "--requirement", requirements_file])
  File "/root/zulip/scripts/lib/zulip_tools.py", line 93, in run
    raise subprocess.CalledProcessError(rc, args) # type: ignore # https://github.com/python/typeshed/pull/329
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['pip', 'install', '--no-deps', '--requirement', '/root/zulip/requirements/py2_prod.txt']' returned non-zero exit status 1

What I can do?

Hi @Jarkko Koistinaho Could you manually run that script and tell what output you get? Also, I would like to know the exact process you followed until you got the error. A step by step description would be best.

You are using pip version 8.1.1, however version 8.1.2 is available.
You should consider upgrading via the 'pip install --upgrade pip' command.
That seems to be a problem with your internet connectivity. Are you behind some kind of proxy?
I could see the upgrade pip log. Did you try it out?

Hi @Tim Abbott , the Twitter searches are running on the cronjob AOK, now, but I'm still stuck with this for the RSS. It's the same zuliprc file which is working for the Twitter searches. Do you have any theories? Thanks again

zulip@zulip-server:~$ /usr/local/share/zulip/integrations/rss/rss-bot --config-file=~/.zuliprc  --stream=rss
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/share/zulip/integrations/rss/rss-bot", line 166, in <module>
    client = zulip.Client(email=opts.email, api_key=opts.api_key,
AttributeError: Values instance has no attribute 'email'
That error looks like it's not finding the config file...
Oh, never mind.
Try changing it to check opts.zulip_email, ops.zulip_api_key, etc.
I think that may be a bug in the rss-bot code
OK, will advise...
there aren't a ton of folks who use RSS these days, so that one may have experienced some bitrot
yeah, it's falling out of favour, but we still get some useful info through it (EmberWeekly etc)
before I change it, could this affect the twitter bot which is using the same zuliprc file?
no luck unfortunately @Tim Abbott , I've tried all the combinations I can think of in the zuliprc too
Oh, I was suggesting changing /usr/local/share/zulip/integrations/rss/rss-bot, not the zuliprc file
I think the code should read e.g. email=opts.zulip_email, not email=opts.zulip
ahhhh....OK...
Bingo..... @Tim Abbott , just had to add zulip_ to all the instances of email, key and site and we have a winner! Legend, thank you again
Cool, I'll fix that in git so it'll be resolved in the next API release.
crusty old guys like me useful for finding crusty old bugs. Thank you again for all your time today!
Thank you for reporting this! It'll save many other users some pain in the future :)
Fixed in master :)

our pleasure, we are loving having Zulip installed, and are hanging out for the GitLab integration. Once we have that, we will have almost the perfect tool for what we want.
One thing we may tackle down the track is an integration to Monit, do you think there would be any wider interest?

@Tim Abbott , one last thing, I noticed this in the console after it had checked the feeds, I have no idea what it is, so shooting it through:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/share/zulip/integrations/rss/rss-bot", line 214, in <module>
    with open(feed_file, "a") as f:
IOError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: '/home/zulip/.cache/zulip-rss/'

Re: Monit, I bet others would be interested, so yeah, worth submitting upstream when you do it.

Re rss-bot, it's constructing the filename like this: urllib.parse.urlparse(feed_url).netloc; what is the feed URL?
I bet the URL has a different form than the tool expects; I can look in the morning if you send me the URL.
thanks, I think I found it, let me check. If it doesn't fix it, I'll shoot it through

that fixed it.... I need a bigger whiteboard to keep track our the beer tally I owe you

I got this error while installing the server (1.4.2) on vanilla Ubuntu 16.04
I'm not sure why this is happening as this comment says that support for Ubuntu 16.04 was added in 1.4.0 

Error: /Stage[main]/Zulip::Nginx/Service[nginx]: Could not evaluate: Execution of '/sbin/status nginx' returned 1: status: Unable to connect to Upstart: Failed to connect to socket /com/ubuntu/upstart: Connection refused
Error: /Stage[main]/Zulip::Nginx/Service[nginx]: Failed to call refresh: Execution of '/sbin/status nginx' returned 1: status: Unabl$ to connect to Upstart: Failed to connect to socket /com/ubuntu/upstart: Connection refused
Error: /Stage[main]/Zulip::Nginx/Service[nginx]: Execution of '/sbin/status nginx' returned 1: status: Unable to connect to Upstart: Failed to connect to socket /com/ubuntu/upstart: Connection refused
I believe the fix for that is uninstalling upstart

quoting from another thread about this: "I've seen that cause problems for people where they need to uninstall upstart (which is only used on Trusty, not Xenial) because not all Ubuntu packages handle the upstrart->systemd migration properly if upstrart is still installed"
related: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/2402

Hi, another question regarding our production server, I was wondering where to find the .css file(s) to modify to change the background colour for Private messages and @mentions. There doesn't appear to be a zulip.css file on the running prod server that I can find.
Is it possible that this is something that could be configured from the admin panel. Thanks.
Also @Tim Abbott , the info regarding the server security was very helpful, and I'm "pretty" happy we've now got something decent in place, thanks
@Zach Casley You may find our HTML and CSS documentation useful.
thanks @Kevin Riggle , I read that first, but was unable to glean from it where I could make the required changes

Ahh, so probably the way you'll want to make changes is using a development environment, and then use either tools/build-release-tarball or to build a release-style tarball for deployment, or more likely scripts/upgrade-zulip-from-git to just deploy a git sha1 to your server
(The latter is only somewhat documented but has some pretty flexible configuration; contributions on that topic are welcome!)
You can just skim the code to see how it works
Anyway for production all our CSS under static/styles gets compressed into something like prod-static/app.css
thanks Tim, I don't have a dev environment, just our production server, so I'll just have to park that one for now. I'll have a look in prod-statis/app.css though, thanks.
makes sense; our documentation should make it pretty easy to set it up on a laptop
OK, that might be a good rainy day project.... I was hoping it might have been a quick fix, and I was just missing something

Hello, please help me
while running vagrant up it shows
Vagrant cannot forward the specified ports on this VM, since they
would collide with some other application that is already listening
on these ports. The forwarded port to 9991 is already in use
on the host machine.
what should i do???
Use vagrant global-status to check if any vagrant instances are running on your machine
If more than once instance is running, you can kill those and start again.

it shows default virtualbox running and,
default virtualbox poweroff

please use the command from console:
netstat -lnp | grep 9991
it will show what application use this port

i m using windows 8.1 and
not able to get what application is using that post
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/48198/how-can-you-find-out-which-process-is-listening-on-a-port-on-windows . You can review this post, there are some solutions for windows machines.
yeah there is something on 127.0.0.1:9991 but in listening state
how do i change my current project's vagrant file to use another port
Restarting usually works for me.

@Sagar khatri You can also edit your zulip Vagrantfile to change the port that you use to access your zulip development server by editing the line that looks like

  host_port = 9991
Hmm I think my original though might be correct, can you show us a screenshot of your terminal?
I guess try vagrant halt and then vagrant up

pasted image
I had run this command:
/root/zulip/scripts/setup/install
Following the instructions from here
https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/prod-install.html
@Aviral Srivastava you need to sudo apt-get remove upstart and then retry; Ubuntu Xenial's upstart configuration breaks their default nginx configuration.
(We've worked around this in the upcoming Zulip 1.5 release)

It worked!
Thanks!
One quick thing, what to set in my external host? I do not have any domain name or something..
If default value doesn't work for you, you can use 'localhost'.
thanks

It is not working. Same error, pasted image
I have tried 'localhost' and '127.0.0.1' as well, in the external host.
You are deploying a production instance?
yes, i have to test python3 version, so yes i have to install the production module.
From the code it seems that 'localhost' should work. 'configtest' only checks for 'zulip.example.com'.
ok
pasted image
see, its no working. :(

We use localhost in our dev settings:

 12 EXTERNAL_HOST = os.getenv('EXTERNAL_HOST')                                                           
 13 if EXTERNAL_HOST is None:                                                                                                                                                                                      
 14     if REALMS_HAVE_SUBDOMAINS:                                                                       
 15         EXTERNAL_HOST = 'zulipdev.com:9991'                                                          
 16     else:                                                                                            
 17         EXTERNAL_HOST = 'localhost:9991'
You can find this file at 'zproject/dev_settings.py'.
thats fine. what else should i do now?
Which settings file are you changing?
etc/Zulip/settings.py
I think setting EXTERNAL_HOST to 'localhost' should work. If it is not working, you can update the hosts file to map a domain name to the loopback address.

localhost didn't work.
and i didnt get the latter part of your message.
Will you be accessing this server remotely?

yes
i need to just test the python3 version, thats it.
Is it your PC or some server with hosting service?
my pc.

any update?
regarding that external host thing? nothing seems to work..

Add the following in /etc/hosts.

127.0.0.1   dev.zulip.com

Then give 'dev.zulip.com' as the external host.

You might have better luck tracking this down with Google, since it's pretty early in the install process and seems to be a vagrant issue. Pinging @Tim Abbott who usually comes online in the next few hours, as he may know this symptom. Good luck!
